019package org.apache.shiro.cache.jcache;
020
021import org.apache.shiro.cache.Cache;
022import org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheException;
023import org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManager;
024import org.apache.shiro.util.Destroyable;
025import org.apache.shiro.util.Initializable;
026import org.apache.shiro.util.StringUtils;
027import org.slf4j.Logger;
028import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
029
030import javax.cache.Caching;
031import javax.cache.configuration.MutableConfiguration;
032import javax.cache.spi.CachingProvider;
033import java.net.URL;
034import java.util.Collection;
035import java.util.Iterator;
036import java.util.Set;
037import java.util.Spliterator;
038import java.util.Spliterators;
039import java.util.stream.Collectors;
040import java.util.stream.Stream;
041import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
042
043/**
044 * Shiro {@code CacheManager} implementation utilizing JCache for all cache functionality.
045 * <p/>
046 * This class can {@link #setCacheManager(javax.cache.CacheManager) accept} a manually configured
047 * {@link javax.cache.CacheManager javax.cache.CacheManager} instance,
048 * a {@code cacheConfig} URI can be specified, or a call to {@link CachingProvider#getCacheManager()} will be used.
049 * <p/>
050 * This implementation requires a JCache implementation available on the classpath.
051 * <p/>
052 * @since 1.9
053 */
054public class JCacheManager implements CacheManager, Initializable, Destroyable {
055
056    /**
057     * This class's private log instance.
058     */
059    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(JCacheManager.class);
060
061    private javax.cache.CacheManager jCacheManager;
062
063    private String cacheConfig;
064
065    /**
066     * Indicates if the CacheManager instance was implicitly/automatically created by this instance, indicating that
067     * it should be automatically cleaned up as well on shutdown.
068     */
069    private boolean cacheManagerImplicitlyCreated = false;
070
071    @Override
072    public <K, V> Cache<K, V> getCache(String name) throws CacheException {
073
074        javax.cache.Cache<K, V> cache = ensureCacheManager().getCache(name);
075
076        if (cache == null) {
077            synchronized (this) {
078                cache = ensureCacheManager().getCache(name);
079                if (cache == null) {
080                    log.debug("Cache with name '{}' does not yet exist.  Creating now.", name);
081                    cache = ensureCacheManager().createCache(name, new MutableConfiguration<>());
082                    log.debug("Added JCache named [{}]", name);
083                } else {
084                    log.debug("Using existing JCache named [{}]", cache.getName());
085                }
086            }
087        }
088
089        return new JCache<>(cache);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Initializes this instance.
094     * <p/>
095     * If a CacheManager has been
096     * explicitly set (e.g. via Dependency Injection or programmatically) prior to calling this
097     * method, this method does nothing.
098     * <p/>
099     * Because Shiro cannot use the failsafe defaults (fail-safe expunges cached objects after 2 minutes,
100     * something not desirable for Shiro sessions), this class manages an internal default configuration for
101     * this case.
102     *
103     * @throws org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheException
104     *          if there are any CacheExceptions thrown by JCache.
105     */
106    public final void init() throws CacheException {
107        ensureCacheManager();
108    }
109
110    private javax.cache.CacheManager ensureCacheManager() {
111        try {
112            if (this.jCacheManager == null) {
113                log.debug("cacheManager property not set.  Constructing CacheManager instance... ");
114                CachingProvider cachingProvider = Caching.getCachingProvider();
115
116                if (StringUtils.hasText(cacheConfig)) {
117
118                    URL config = getClass().getResource(cacheConfig);
119                    if (config == null) {
120                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("Could not load JCache configuration resource: " + cacheConfig);
121                    }
122
123                    this.jCacheManager = cachingProvider.getCacheManager(config.toURI(), getClass().getClassLoader());
124                } else {
125                    this.jCacheManager = cachingProvider.getCacheManager();
126                }
127
128                cacheManagerImplicitlyCreated = true;
129                log.debug("implicit cacheManager created successfully.");
130            }
131            return this.jCacheManager;
132        } catch (Exception e) {
133            throw new CacheException(e);
134        }
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Shuts-down the wrapped JCache CacheManager <b>only if implicitly created</b>.
139     * <p/>
140     * If another component injected
141     * a non-null CacheManager into this instance before calling {@link #init() init}, this instance expects that same
142     * component to also destroy the CacheManager instance, and it will not attempt to do so.
143     */
144    public void destroy() {
145        if (cacheManagerImplicitlyCreated) {
146            try {
147                jCacheManager.close();
148            } catch (Throwable t) {
149                    log.warn("Unable to cleanly shutdown implicitly created CacheManager instance. Ignoring (shutting down)...", t);
150            } finally {
151                this.jCacheManager = null;
152                this.cacheManagerImplicitlyCreated = false;
153            }
154        }
155    }
156
157    public String getCacheConfig() {
158        return cacheConfig;
159    }
160
161    public void setCacheConfig(String jCacheConfig) {
162        this.cacheConfig = jCacheConfig;
163    }
164
165    public javax.cache.CacheManager getCacheManager() {
166        return jCacheManager;
167    }
168
169    public void setCacheManager(javax.cache.CacheManager jCacheManager) {
170        this.jCacheManager = jCacheManager;
171    }
172
173    static class JCache<K,V> implements Cache<K,V> {
174
175        private final javax.cache.Cache<K,V> cache;
176
177        JCache(javax.cache.Cache<K,V> cache) {
178            this.cache = cache;
179        }
180        /**
181         * Gets a value of an element which matches the given key.
182         *
183         * @param key the key of the element to return.
184         * @return The value placed into the cache with an earlier put, or null if not found or expired
185         */
186        @Override
187        public V get(K key) throws CacheException {
188            try {
189                log.trace("Getting object from cache [{}] for key [{}]", cache.getName(), key);
190                if (key == null) {
191                    return null;
192                } else {
193                    V element = cache.get(key);
194                    if (element == null) {
195                        log.trace("Element for [{}] is null.", key);
196                        return null;
197                    } else {
198                        return element;
199                    }
200                }
201            } catch (Throwable t) {
202                throw new CacheException(t);
203            }
204        }
205
206        /**
207         * Puts an object into the cache.
208         *
209         * @param key   the key.
210         * @param value the value.
211         */
212        public V put(K key, V value) throws CacheException {
213            log.trace("Putting object in cache [{}] for key [{}]", cache.getName(), key);
214            try {
215                V previous = get(key);
216                cache.put(key, value);
217                return previous;
218            } catch (Throwable t) {
219                throw new CacheException(t);
220            }
221        }
222
223        /**
224         * Removes the element which matches the key.
225         *
226         * <p>If no element matches, nothing is removed and no Exception is thrown.</p>
227         *
228         * @param key the key of the element to remove
229         */
230        public V remove(K key) throws CacheException {
231            log.trace("Removing object from cache [{}] for key [{}]", cache.getName(), key);
232            try {
233                return cache.getAndRemove(key);
234            } catch (Throwable t) {
235                throw new CacheException(t);
236            }
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Removes all elements in the cache, but leaves the cache in a useable state.
241         */
242        public void clear() throws CacheException {
243            log.trace("Clearing all objects from cache [{}]", cache.getName());
244            try {
245                cache.removeAll();
246            } catch (Throwable t) {
247                throw new CacheException(t);
248            }
249        }
250
251        public int size() {
252            return (int) toStream(cache.iterator()).count();
253        }
254
255        @Override
256        public Set<K> keys() {
257            return toStream(cache.iterator())
258                    .map(javax.cache.Cache.Entry::getKey)
259                    .collect(Collectors.toSet());
260        }
261
262        @Override
263        public Collection<V> values() {
264            return toStream(cache.iterator())
265                    .map(javax.cache.Cache.Entry::getValue)
266                    .collect(Collectors.toSet());
267        }
268
269        private Stream<javax.cache.Cache.Entry<K, V>> toStream(Iterator<javax.cache.Cache.Entry<K, V>> iterator) {
270            return StreamSupport.stream(Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(iterator, Spliterator.ORDERED), false);
271        }
272    }
273}
